content: 15 sts row 10 *k2 p1 repeat from * to end 2 nearly there … row 11 *k1 p2tog repeat from * to end 10 sts row 12 *k1 p1 repeat from * to end cast off working in k1 p1 rib for a tea cosy that leaves the lid uncovered cast off after row 2 sewing it together although mistake rib is reversible all that decreasing will mean that the two sides of the knitting at the top will be slightly different you may or may not be able to see this in the pictures below side 1 side 2 on side 1 every other column of ribs stops at the line on side 2 the pairs of rib columns join above the line it doesn t matter which side you use as the right side of your cosy but just make sure that both pieces of knitting have the same side as their right side if you put the two pieces on top of each other so that there s a cast on or cast off tail at each of the four corners then they are both the same way round sew the two pieces together leaving gaps for the handle and spout it is easiest to do this if you have the teapot to hand and can try the cosy on as you go to check the fit if you don t i suggest using the measurements that follow on the next page 3 for the smaller size join 2 5cm / 1 below the handle and 5cm / 2 above it join 2cm / ¾ below the spout and 6cm / 2½ above it for the bigger size join 3cm / 1¼ below the handle and 6cm / 2½ above it join 2 5cm / 1 below the spout and 10cm / 4 above it these are the measurements i used for the tea cosies in the pictures abbreviations st / sts stitch / stitches k knit p purl kf&b knit into the front and back of the stitch k2tog knit two stitches together p2tog purl two stitches together © frankie brown 2008 updated 2023 mypatterns areforpersonaluseonlyandshouldnotbeusedtomakeitems forsale pleasedonotusethemforteachingpurposes withoutmypermission 4
